definition: (of a woman) to marry a man of lower social status/to marry down
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)

sentences.english: As she was wonderful- she married a door-keeper coming from the country.
sentences.chinese: 由于她是个“骚货”，下嫁给一个墟落来的看门人。

sentences.english: I think you may deign to marry me. I don't want to be an Adonis.
sentences.chinese: 你要屈尊下嫁，我可不想当小白脸儿。

sentences.english: They thought she had married beneath her, ie married a man of lower social status.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为她下嫁给了社会地位比她低的人。

sentences.english: The queen's granddaughter Zara Phillips married rugby ace Mike Tindall in Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 皇后的孙女萨拉公主在苏格兰下嫁橄榄球明星丁达尔。

sentences.english: As she was beautiful, she married a door-keeper coming from the country.
sentences.chinese: 因为她是个“骚货”，下嫁给一个农村来的看门人。

sentences.english: She took the material life years ago by marring Richard for fulfilling American dream.
sentences.chinese: 多年前下嫁理查德实现了物质生活的梦想。

definition: (of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to betroth a girl (in arranged marriages)
to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
to break a promise of marriage
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
to take a wife/to get married (man)
to give oneself wholly to/to put oneself at sb's service/(of a woman) to give one's body to/to marry
